Description.val: This line item funds modifications to a group of trainer aircraft which includes T-44A/C and TH-57.  The trainer aircraft are described as follows:  The T-44 is a twin-engine, multi-seat turboprop aircraft produced by Hawker Beech Aircraft used to simulate operation of multi engine aircraft, specifically the P-3; the TH-57 is a single-engine, multi-seat rotary wing aircraft used for helicopter training. The overall goal of the modification is to maintain safe and reliable operation of the trainer aircraft through the timely installation of necessary changes. Total numbers for T-44 and TH-57 aircraft are 54 and 126, respectively.

Name.@footnote: FY15 funding realigned from training equipment to the installation of Digital Engine gauges, due to a change in strategy with respect to simulators and the requirement to fund the installation of the gauges.
Depot installations are delayed due to reduced funding at FRC caused from sequestration and Congressional marks.
Name.val: 1.1.1) Install Kits - A kits (A to C Conversion) - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: FY16-20 includes the addition of the new Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast OUT (ADS-B) Out capability for the T44.  This new capability will be compliant with the FAA Next Generation Air Transportation System and FAA modernization and Reform Act by 2020.  This capability upgrade will be incorporated into the aircraft avionics hardware and software components along with training courseware and hardware.

Name.val: Vector - Digital Engine Gauges/ Install A kits

ImplementationMethodName.val: Depot Level Install:: Installation Name: Kits- A to C conversion/Digital Engine Gauges

Name.@footnote: At PB, Digital Engine gauge funding was erroneously reported under two cost elements due to a misunderstanding regarding the installation method. Combined under one CE for DoN16. FY14 funding from OSIP 07-07 Wing Wiring was shifted to OSIP 05-04 T-44 Avionics Obsolescence to fund the total qty of 18 Digital Engine Gauges.  Depot installations are delayed due to reduced funding at FRC caused from sequestration and Congressional marks.

Description.val:
The T-44A Avionics are becoming unsupportable due to non-availability of parts.   The following analog avionics systems require replacement: NCS-31A Area Navigation/Control System, AP-106 Autopilot, Flight Director, digital engine gauges and the RDR-130 Weather Radar. Following these avionics obsolescence modifications, the T-44A aircraft are re-designated T-44Cs. Avionics are being returned from the repair vendor Beyond Economical Repair (BER) due to non-availability of parts.  As avionics become BER due to lack of parts, spares are being depleted and are not available in the commercial market.  Lack of avionics will ground aircraft and severely degrade Chief of Naval Air Training's ability to meet Pilot Training Requirements.  Current plans call for T-44 to fly its training mission until 2025. There are currently 16 T-44A's in the inventory and all 16 will receive this modification for a total of 54 T-44C's.  All remaining T-44A's are on track for modifications.  FY16-20 includes the addition of the new Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast OUT (ADS-B) Out capability for the T44.  This new capability will be compliant with the FAA Next Generation Air Transportation System and FAA modernization and Reform Act by 2020.  This capability upgrade will be incorporated into the aircraft avionics hardware and software components along with training courseware and hardware. 
      
DEVELOPMENT STATUS / MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  
The T-44 Avionics Obsolescence (Operational, Safety, and Improvement Program 005-04) non-recurring engineering occurred in FY04.   Commercially available Non-Development Item kit procurement began in FY05 and installations in FY05.  Beginning in FY13, kits were commercially procured via a Fleet Support Team (FST) contract and installed by Fleet Readiness Center Southeast (FRCSE).

Name.@footnote: In FY17, data pubs will be procured as part of the upgrade to comply with NextGen requirements.
FY15 funding added since PB for support to award simulator and courseware upgrades that take place from FY16 and out.  Variance per FY relates to the types of devices being procured each year.
In FY18, ILS is required for Information Assurance and Information Technology approval.
The increase in labor from FY15 to FY16 was due to NAWCTSD support required for simulator procurement.

In FY16 and out, kits will be procured as part of the upgrade to comply with NextGen requirements. Qty of 52 kits will be Depot Level installed. The fluctuation in cost is due to the different quantities of lot purchase.
FY16 Low Rate Initital Production (LRIP) kits qty (10) are higher costs per unit. The fluctuation in cost thoughout the FYDP is due to different quantities of lot purchase.
Prior years (FY12) Radar Altimeter 4 VAL/VER kits - O level installed.  FY15 ADS-B Out 4 VAL/VER kits - O level installed
Prior years (FY13) funding provided for 126 Radar Altimiter kits. Qty of 52 kits will be Depot Level installed.

Description.val:
Description:
The TH-57 is the sole platform for primary and advanced helicopter flight training for student aviators and foreign military pilots (United States Navy, United States Marine Corps, United States Coast Guard). This modernization effort capitalizes on technology improvements to aircraft and Ground Based Training Systems (GBTS) in order to comply with Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) national airspace NextGen requirements by FY20. The effort includes upgrading the aircraft avionics components, installation of a new Automatic Dependent Surveillance -Broadcast (ADS-B) OUT hardware, and procuring new GBTS to satisfy documented requirement gaps. GBTS includes procuring a combination of full flight simulator training devices, cockpit procedural trainers; computer based training courseware and hardware. 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  The components of this block upgrade will be Commercial off the Shelf.
